Actinic Keratosis.symptoms: Rough, scaly patches on sun-exposed skin.
Actinic Keratosis.severity: Requires medical attention to prevent progression to carcinoma.

Basal Cell Carcinoma.symptoms: Pearly or waxy bump, often with visible blood vessels.
Basal Cell Carcinoma.home_remedies: Sunscreen use, avoiding excessive sun exposure.

Squamous Cell Carcinoma.symptoms: Red, scaly patches or open sores that do not heal.

Melanoma.symptoms: Irregularly shaped dark mole, rapid growth.

Benign Keratosis.severity: Usually harmless but should be monitored.

Dermatofibroma.severity: Benign, but consult a doctor if painful.

Seborrheic Keratosis.symptoms: Waxy, scaly, raised growths that appear brown or black.
Seborrheic Keratosis.severity: Non-cancerous, but removal may be needed for cosmetic reasons.

Solar Lentigo.symptoms: Flat, brown spots caused by sun exposure.
Solar Lentigo.severity: Harmless but may require monitoring for changes.

Cherry Angioma.symptoms: Small, red or purple bumps caused by dilated blood vessels.
Cherry Angioma.severity: Benign, but removal may be desired for cosmetic reasons.

Melanocytic Nevi (Common Moles).symptoms: Small, round, brown or black spots on the skin.
Melanocytic Nevi (Common Moles).severity: Low risk but should be checked for changes.

Dysplastic Nevi (Atypical Moles).symptoms: Irregularly shaped moles with uneven color.
Dysplastic Nevi (Atypical Moles).cure_remedy: Surgical removal if signs of malignancy appear.
Dysplastic Nevi (Atypical Moles).home_remedies: Avoid excessive sun exposure, use sunscreen.

Lentigo (Sun Spots).symptoms: Flat, brown spots caused by sun exposure.
Lentigo (Sun Spots).severity: Harmless but may require monitoring for changes.

Vitiligo.symptoms: Loss of skin pigment in patches.
Vitiligo.severity: Non-threatening but may require cosmetic treatment.

Melasma.symptoms: Brown or gray patches on the face.

Post-Inflammatory Hyperpigmentation.symptoms: Darkened skin areas after injury or inflammation.
Post-Inflammatory Hyperpigmentation.severity: Harmless but may require cosmetic treatment.

Vascular Lesions.symptoms: Red or purple spots, often raised.
Vascular Lesions.severity: Usually harmless but may require cosmetic treatment.

Cherry Angioma.symptoms: Small, red or purple bumps caused by dilated blood vessels.
Cherry Angioma.severity: Benign, but removal may be desired for cosmetic reasons.

Hemangioma.symptoms: Raised, red or bluish growths caused by abnormal blood vessels.
Hemangioma.home_remedies: Cold compress, avoiding trauma to the area.
Hemangioma.severity: Usually harmless but may require treatment if large or growing.

Port-Wine Stain.symptoms: Flat, red or purple birthmark that does not fade over time.
Port-Wine Stain.severity: Harmless but may require cosmetic treatment.

Spider Angioma.symptoms: Small, red spot with radiating blood vessels.
Spider Angioma.severity: Usually benign but may indicate liver disease if multiple lesions appear.

Acne Vulgaris.symptoms: Red pimples, blackheads, whiteheads, and cysts on the face, chest, and back.
Acne Vulgaris.cure_remedy: Topical retinoids, benzoyl peroxide, oral antibiotics.
Acne Vulgaris.home_remedies: Tea tree oil, honey masks, green tea extract.
Acne Vulgaris.severity: Mild to severe—consult a dermatologist for persistent cases.

Rosacea.symptoms: Facial redness, visible blood vessels, and occasional bumps or pustules.

Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis).symptoms: Dry, itchy, inflamed skin, often in patches.
Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis).severity: Can be severe—consult a dermatologist for persistent flare-ups.

Psoriasis.symptoms: Thick, scaly patches of skin, often on elbows, knees, and scalp.

Seborrheic Dermatitis.symptoms: Red, greasy skin with flaky white or yellow scales, often on the scalp.
Seborrheic Dermatitis.home_remedies: Apple cider vinegar rinse, tea tree oil.

Contact Dermatitis.symptoms: Red, itchy rash caused by skin contact with allergens or irritants.
Contact Dermatitis.severity: Mild to severe—depends on exposure and reaction.

Impetigo.symptoms: Red sores that rupture, ooze, and form a yellow-brown crust.

Cellulitis.symptoms: Painful, red, swollen skin with warmth and tenderness.
Cellulitis.cure_remedy: Oral antibiotics, hospitalization in severe cases.

Ringworm (Tinea).symptoms: Circular, red, scaly rash with a raised border.

Herpes Simplex.symptoms: Painful blisters or sores around the mouth or genitals.

Warts (HPV).symptoms: Small, rough growths on the skin caused by HPV.

Scabies.symptoms: Intense itching, especially at night, with small burrow tracks.

Lupus Erythematosus.symptoms: Butterfly-shaped rash on the face, joint pain, fatigue.

Scleroderma.symptoms: Hardening and tightening of the skin, Raynaud’s phenomenon.

Pemphigus.symptoms: Painful blisters on the skin and mucous membranes.
Pemphigus.severity: Serious autoimmune disorder—requires urgent medical attention.

Bullous Pemphigoid.symptoms: Large, fluid-filled blisters on the skin.
Bullous Pemphigoid.severity: Requires medical treatment—can be life-threatening in severe cases.

Ichthyosis.symptoms: Dry, scaly skin resembling fish scales.

Atopic Dermatitis.severity: Can be severe—consult a dermatologist for persistent flare-ups.
